By James Clay

Break out of the trap of British mediocrity and see the world

Sadly to say, truly fantastic opportunities just don't come along all that often, nor do they necessarily make themselves obvious when they do, which serves to highlight the importance of grabbing them while you can

P.O.R.N.O is a bad advert for feminism

I've got to be honest; P.O.R.N.O. V. is posing a tricky question for me

Moving Langwith to Hes East presents a difficult challenge

Having no actual experience in the matter, I imagine that running a university is a constant balancing act. For every action, there are repercussions; for every step forward, there is a step back

Departmental cuts a symptom of devaluation in education

As York's academic departments are called upon to collectively make PS1.2 million in savings, there is the considerable temptation to suggest that these budget cuts should indeed be made on an uneven and disproportionate basis

Weather worries should quickly melt away

As many may have noticed, a few weeks ago our small island was brought an inordinate amount of snow

Trust in the independence of students

How much do you know about your lecturers? You probably know their name, their preferred apparel, their accent and therefore perhaps even their home town

Part-time students are owed more

Money, money, money. It is bound to come up in conversation at some point during the week

Cartoon

By James Bithell

<a href="http://www.nouse.co.uk/2010/01/26/cartoon-4/"><img src="http://www.nouse.co.uk/wp-content/article_images/body/2010/01/lewbee-lemon.png" alt="lewbee-lemon" title="lewbee-lemon" width="400" height="236" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-19020" /></a> Maxine Mutten

The Acquaintance

It's nice to be back. Nice is my "mot de jour"; whether it's "nice to see you", "nice one" or "you look nice", I'm all about the euphemism

University gym memberships are an expensive joke

At PS256 per year (including the sports membership fee of PS40 that claims to 'save' students money), York has one of the highest, and in my opinion ridiculously overpriced, university gym memberships available

Long live technology, but leave literature alone

It's a truth universally acknowledged that a book should be made out of paper, beautifully printed and bound with love

Annoyance at end of year list-mania is perhaps misguided

Towards the end of a year I find that I am increasingly irritated by the incessant 'round up' television and radio programs offered for our delectation

Naming nightmare: the main problem facing us for 2010

What I'm wondering is what do we call this decade?

YSTV and URY deserve more help in achieving their due popularity

If these are meant to be some of the largest societies on campus, why is student knowledge of them so limited?

Student budgeting is being pushed to breaking point by Christmas

Unless we already have a job back home that allows seasonal work, trying to balance the amount of money we spend during Christmas just isn't possible

No room for avoidable errors

It is a universal truth that when a company are contracted that has made no profit for the past five years disaster will ensure

Letting ourselves down

At first glance, it looks like just another minor detriment to the student population of the University of York

York Come Donating

Last year this newspaper witnessed York Come Dancing's escapades unfold in a location far too small for the number of attendees present

A campus culture of drinking is at serious risk of extinction

Finally, we have our own miniature Carnage to fret over

Gender agenda: why men deserve consideration too

While issues of women's inequality have long been rife, men's welfare issues are at risk of being overlooked

Student welfare needs to come before petty bickering

Moving out of campus accommodation involves much more than a change of location

The newest legal drugs are just as dangerous, if less well known

As a new wave of legal highs takes Britain by storm, the tabloid press are waking up to easy stories of abuse

Fighting back against my critics

I have returned to the University media for the first time this year, in order to give those of you who are new a bit of an introduction to where I stand within the University

University diligence is severely lacking

Whichever way you look at it, PS2.4 million is a lot of money to be throwing about. It seems even more when you're not getting the results you were paying so much for

New fees may make social divisions worse

The University of York could soon be turning into a real-life social melodrama based on college accommodation

JCRC election campaigns are worryingly reliant on Facebook

My flatmates grew increasingly restless throughout last week, frustrated about being inundated with Facebook messages advertising Junior Common Room Committee (JCRC) election candidates

Maintaining perspective on privacy

Privacy is a pretty dubious concept at university. You just have time to accept that when sharing one shower between twelve people, you get used to finding your flatmate passed out naked on the kitchen floor, and you eventually learn to block out the questionable noises drifting through paper thin walls late at night
